chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
The Lord God showed me this. This is the voice of all the proud, who, relying on their own strength, might have temporary power that they could only receive from God. But they attribute it more to their own virtue than to God. And behold, the creator of the locust at the beginning of the late rain sprouting, and behold, the late rain after the shearer of the flock.

And it happened when he had finished consuming the grass of the earth, and I said: Lord God, be merciful, I beg you. Who will raise Jacob, for he is small? The creator of the locust and the creator is God. They come at the beginning of the late rain, which is in the springtime when everything flourishes. But these locusts were followed by countless caterpillars, which came after the late rain and were called the shearer or the shearing of the flock. This undoubtedly signified the two kings of the Assyrians and the army of the Chaldeans, who devastated the nation of the Jews.

Otherwise: Gog, king of the locusts, who according to the Septuagint interpreters is called, means "roof," signifies a certain proud and arrogant strength of the Antichrist. At the end of the world, coming with an innumerable multitude of unbelievers, like in the late rain, he will consume all the grass of the earth, that is, all the weak and tender aspects of the human race. Hence, the prophet intercedes with God for the people of Israel, because they are small in understanding, so that, with a changed judgment, at least a remnant of them may be saved. But the Lord had mercy on this. It will not be, said the Lord.

The Lord God showed me this, and behold, the Lord God will call judgment to fire, and it will devour the great abyss and consume a part of it. And I said: Lord God, cease, I beg you. Who will raise Jacob, for he is small? The Lord had mercy on this. But this too will not be, said the Lord God.

The Lord God showed me this. Judgment is indeed called to fire when the sentence of justice for eternal burning is shown. And it devours the great abyss because it burns the wicked and incomprehensible minds of men, which now even shine before men with the miracles of proud deeds.
chunks.original_latin:
Haec ostendit mihi Dominus Deus. Haec vox
 omnium superborum est, qui in fortitudine sua fisi,
temporalem potentiam, quam nonnisi a Deo accepissent,
habere poterant, suae virtuti magis quam
Deo ascribunt. Et ecce fictor locustae in principio
germinantium serotini imbris, et ecce serotinus
post tonsorem gregis. Et factum est cum consummasset
comedere herbam terrae, et dixi: Domine
Deus, propitius esto, obsecro. Quis suscitabit Jacob,
quia parvulus est? Fictor locustae et creator Deus
est. Hae veniunt in principio imbris serotini, hoc est
verno tempore quando cuncta virent. Has autem
locustas innumerabilis bruchus sequebatur, qui veniebat
post imbrem serotinum, et appellabatur tonsor,
vel tonsura gregis, qui duos reges Assyriorum atque
exercitum Chaldaeorum, qui Judaeorum gentem depopulati
 sunt, significasse non dubium est. Aliter:
Gog rex locustarum, qui secundum Septuaginta interpretes
positus est, interpretatur tectum, superba
quaedam et arrogans fortitudo Antichristi significatur,
qui in fine mundi cum innumerabili infidelium
multitudine veniens, velut in serotino, cunctam herbam
terrae, hoc est omnia infirma et tenera humani
generis consumptura est. Unde et propheta pro populo
Israel, quia parvulus est sensu, Deum interpellat,
ut, mutata sententia, saltem reliquiae ex eis
salventur. Misertus est autem Dominus super hoc. Non
erit, dixit Dominus. Haec ostendit mihi Dominus
Deus, et ecce vocabit judicium ad ignem Dominus
 Deus, et devorabit abyssum multam, et comedit
simul partem, et dixi: Domine Deus, quiesce, obsecro. Quis suscitabit Jacob, quia parvulus est? Misertus
est Dominus super hoc. Sed et istud non erit,
dixit Dominus Deus. Haec ostendit mihi Dominus
Deus. Judicium quippe ad ignem vocatur, cum
justitiae sententia ad poenam aeternae concremationis
ostenditur, et multam abyssum devorat, quia iniquas
atque incomprehensibiles hominum mentes concremat,
quae nunc coram hominibus etiam superborum
operum miraculis coruscant.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
But part of the house is consumed, because hell also devours those who now pride themselves on being among the elect through supposedly holy acts.

And behold, the Lord stands on a wall plastered, and in His hand is a trowel. The Lord said to me: What do you see, Amos? I said: A trowel. The Lord said: Behold, I will set a trowel in the midst of my people Israel. I will not add to them again. The high places of the idol will be demolished, the sanctuaries of Israel will be desolated, and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword. The trowel signifies the Lord's protection, which He has taken away from His people Israel, as from the former building. The diamond, a very hard, unbreakable, and unattractive stone, prefigures our Lord and Savior, who, though He was in the form of God, did not consider equality with God something to be grasped, but emptied Himself, taking the form of a servant. He stands on a diamond wall, that is, on the incorruptible building of the Church.

And Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent a message to Jeroboam, king of Israel, saying: Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel; the land cannot bear all his words.

For Amos says: Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will surely go into exile away from their land. Amaziah said to Amos: Seer, go, flee to the land of Judah. Earn your bread there, and prophesy there. But do not prophesy any more at Bethel, for it is the king's sanctuary and the house of the kingdom.

All that is contained in this prophecy about Amaziah, Jeroboam, and Israel should be interpreted metaphorically as referring to heretics. Amaziah, the priest, sometimes sends messages to Jeroboam, the king and patron of heretics, accusing holy men and preachers of faith before him. He orders teachers not to preach in Israel so they do not go against the king's will. Because Bethel, which means the house of God, and the false Church is the king's sanctuary and the house of the kingdom.

They often say: The emperor supports us, and if anyone resists him, they are immediately slandered. So, you act against the emperor, you despise the commands of Augustus.
chunks.original_latin:
Pars autem domus comeditur,
quia illos quoque gehenna devorat, qui
nunc se quasi in sanctis actibus de electorum numero
esse gloriantur. Et ecce Dominus stans super murum litum, et
 in manu ejus trulla caementarii. Et dixit Dominus
ad me: Quid tu vides, Amos? Et dixi: Trullam caementarii. Et dixit Dominus: Ecce ego ponam trullam
in medio populi mei Israel, non adjiciam ultra
superinducere eum, et demolientur excelsa idoli, et
sanctificationes Israel desolabuntur, et consurgam super
domum Jeroboam in gladio. Trulla caementarii
significat Domini protectionem, quam populo suo
Israel, quasi a priori aedificio abstulit. Adamas vero
lapis durissimus et indomabilis atque indecorus, praefigurat
Dominum atque Salvatorem nostrum, qui
cum in forma Dei esset, non rapinam arbitratus est
esse se aequalem Deo, sed semetipsum exinanivit formam
servi accipiens. Hic stat super murum adamantinum,
hoc est super incorruptum Ecclesiae aedificium. Et misit Amasias sacerdos Bethel ad Jeroboam
regem Israel, dicens: Rebellavit contra te Amos in
medio domus Israel, non poterit terra sustinere universos
sermones ejus. Haec enim dicit Amos: In
gladio morietur Jeroboam, et Israel captivus migrabit
de terra sua. Et dixit Amasias ad Amos: Qui
vides, gradere, fuge in terram Juda, et comede ibi
panem, et ibi prophetabis, et in Bethel non adjicies
ultra ut prophetes, quia sanctificatio regis est, et
domus regni est. Omnia quae de Amasia et Jeroboam
et Israel in hac prophetia continentur, tropologice
ad haereticos transferenda sunt, quorum sacerdos
Amasias solet aliquando mittere ad Jeroboam
regem haereticorum atque patronum, et sanctos viros
 ac praecones fidei accusare apud eum, et jubere
doctoribus ne praedicent in Israel, ne contra regis
faciant voluntatem: quia Bethel, hoc est domus Dei,
et falsa Ecclesia sanctificatio regis sit et domus
regni. Solent enim dicere: Imperator nobis communicat,
et si quis ei restiterit, statim calumniatur. Ergo tu contra imperatorem facis, Augusti mandata
contemnis.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
And Amos replied to Amaziah: I am not a prophet, nor the son of a prophet; I am a herdsman and a tender of sycamore figs. The Lord took me from following the flock and said to me: Go, prophesy to my people Israel.

Some argue that sycamores should be called sycamines, a type of tree that grows in the plains of Palestine and produces wild fruit. If these fruits are not tended, they become very bitter, and the tree is ruined. However, since the wilderness where Amos lived does not grow such trees, it seems more likely he was referring to bushes that bear berries, helping to sustain the hunger and needs of shepherds. Others assert that sycamores symbolized all fruitful trees.

Now listen to the word of the Lord: You say, do not prophesy against Israel and do not preach against the house of idols. Because of this, the Lord God says: Your wife will be unfaithful in the city, and your sons and daughters will fall by the sword; your land will be measured out and divided, and you will die in a defiled land, and Israel will go into exile from its land.

This is what the Scripture recalls the apostles did; when the scribes and Pharisees warned them not to teach in the name of Jesus, they responded, saying: We must obey God rather than men. This is also what the prophet Amos did. Amaziah, who now boasts of his priestly power, will die in a land defiled by idols and will not die before he sees the people he deceived serving as captives.

Amaziah, whose name means strong and rigid, is rebellious and fierce, forbidding a true ecclesiastic man and prophet from speaking God's word and correcting the erring people. He undoubtedly displayed the arrogance of heretics. The wife of these heretics, which is the false Church, will be revealed to all the faithful as an adulterous people, and their sons and daughters born in error will be struck by the Lord's indignation or by their own impiety.
chunks.original_latin:
Et respondit Amos, et dixit ad Amasiam: Non
sum propheta, et non sum filius prophetae, sed armentarius
ego sum, vellicans sycomoros, et tulit me
Dominus cum sequerer gregem, et dixit ad me:
Vade, propheta ad populum meum Israel. Sycomoros
quidam ita disserunt, ut sycamina velint
appellare, genus arborum quae in Palaestina nascuntur
in campestribus, et agrestes afferunt fructus:
quae si non vellicentur, amarissimas cariculas faciunt,
et aquicelus corrumpitur. Nobis autem, quia solitudo
in quam morabatur Amos nullam hujuscemodi gignit
arborum, magis videtur rubos dicere, qui ferunt
mora, et pastorum famem ac penuriam consolantur. Sunt et alii qui sycomoros omnes fructuosas arbores
significasse astruunt. Et nunc audi verbum Domini: Tu dicis, non
prophetabis super Israel, et non stillabis super domum
idoli; propter hoc haec dicit Dominus Deus:
Uxor tua in civitate fornicabitur, et filii tui et filiae
tuae in gladio cadent, et humus tua funiculo metietur,
et tu in terra polluta morieris, et Israel captivus
migrabit de terra sua. Hoc est quod apostolos
Scriptura fecisse commemorat; quando denuntiaverunt
eis scribae et Pharisaei, ne docerent in nomine
Jesu, et illi responderunt dicentes. Obedire oportet
Deo magis quam hominibus, quod etiam prophetam
Amos fecisse cognoscimus. Amasias quoque,
qui nunc gloriatur in sacerdotii potestate, moriatur
 in terra quae polluta est idolis, et non ante moriatur
nisi populum quem deceperat servientem videat
atque captivum. Amasias, qui interpretatur robustus
ac rigidus, eo quod rebellis sit et ferox, et ecclesiasticum
virum et vere prophetam vetet Dei proferre
sermonem, et errantem populum corrigere, arrogantiam
haereticorum praetendisse non dubium est. Horum haereticorum uxor, hoc est falsa Ecclesia,
patebit omnibus fidelibus esse plebs adultera, et filii
ejus ac filiae quas male genuerunt in errorem, Domini
indignatione vel certe propria impietate feriantur.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
    The land and all its possessions will belong to demons. They will perish in a polluted land, abandoned by God.

</speak>
chunks.original_latin:
Humus quoque illius et universa possessio erit
pars daemonum, et ipsi morientur in terra polluta,
quae habitatorem Deum non habet.
